Want to upgrade your programming skills? We are glad to announce our first ICPC Camps at Innopolis University, which will happen from 14 to 18 December! Have Timus Online account on timus.online. 2. Solve 50 tasks on Timus Online by 6 December. 3. Register for the camp by 29 November here. Nintendo Entertainment System, originally known as FamiCom in Japan or by it's clone's name Dendy in post-Soviet countries, has brought Video Game Consoles back from the dead and revolutionized them. Many incredible games originated on the NES, with many clever programmers pushing the limits of the small box to it's extremes. Join us Saturday, on February 8th, at 16:00 at auditorium 305! We will take a deep dive into the guts of the legendary gaming console, and discuss aspects of emulating it's games! Join us atLow Level Programming Club for updates on this event, announcements of new lectures, workshops and talks. We also discuss the world of Embedded and System programming, and wait for you to share your projects and interests with us!

Good Economy for Tough Times" lecture by Esther Duflo, professor at the Massachusetts University of Technology (MIT) and winner of the 2019 Alfred Nobel Memorial Economics Prize for an Experimental Approach to Fighting Global Poverty. Among the main problems of today's global economy are inequality, social insecurity, ecology, migration, and slowing economic growth. But in public debate, these issues are often seen quite differently than scientists. What myths exist today regarding economic policy? And what solutions to pressing economic problems do modern researchers have? About the lecturer: Esther Duflo is one of the leading experts in poverty and development economics. Her research interests include inequality, migration, social insecurity caused by economic, cultural, political and environmental factors. When: 16 sept 17:00 Format: online. Register here.

How will the Spring Ball go on? The Spring Ball is approaching extremely fast. Now it is time to open some secrets to you! Crowd Science Seminar Title: NuCLS: a scalable crowdsourcing approach and dataset for nucleus classification, localization and segmentation Speaker: Mohamed Amgad, Northwestern University (Chicago, USA) ML models are used in pathology to make advances in diagnosis and treatment. But there's a major obstacle: it requires obtaining large high-resolution datasets. Using a recent dataset of breast cancer cells annotated by students, Mohamed Amgad offers a crowdsourcing-based solution. Don't miss a chance to learn about the role of computer vision and crowdsourcing in ongoing hard science research! 29 July, 19:00 Online (in english) To learn more and join online please follow the link in CrowdScience.ai About Crowd Science Seminars: CSS cover a broad area of Human-AI collaboration with a goal to create a venue where researchers and practitioners from various labs and industries across the globe can discuss their past and future work, exchange ideas, and establish new collaborations.

Crowd Science Seminar by Yandex Title: Feet-on-street Crowdsourcing Speaker: Evgenii Konovalov, Head of the Spatial crowdsourcing service at Yandex Crowdsourcing relies on the contributions of many workers to accomplish tasks that are usually easier for humans than for computers.This talk will introduce feet-on-street crowdsourcing, also known as spatial crowdsourcing, which implies performing the given task in a real-world location. We will overview the successful applications of spatial crowdsourcing inside and outside Yandex. Also, we will discuss the specifics of the feet-on-street tasks and managing them in human-in-the-loop pipelines. Come and learn how feet-on-street crowdsourcing helps to digitalize the offline world! 12 August, 19:00 Online (in english) To learn more and join online please follow the link in CrowdScience.ai About Crowd Science Seminars: CSS cover a broad area of Human-AI collaboration with a goal to create a venue where researchers and practitioners from various labs and industries across the globe can discuss their past and future work, exchange ideas, and establish new collaborations. The series feature talks from rising stars and established experts which are followed by an open discussion between attendees.

Innopolis Blockchain Club invites you to join their meetings! Blockchain is a decentralized platform that provides an underlying supporting layer for many cutting-edge services (Bitcoin and Ethereum to name a few). Blockchain development skills are currently in high demand although a lot of programmers are shifting towards it. Why joining? - Learn more about a non-conventional service model (other than server-client model) and the economical theory of cryptocurrencies - Learn how to program smart contracts (in Solidity programming language) and create decentralized applications to help building a new web with no authority but the authority of the public. - Participate in hackathons with like-minded people and win prizes. - Acquire necessary knowledge to invest in the crypto space and avoid crypto spammimg, or how to be a spammer yourself Thursdays: 20:00 - 22:00 room 312 Join club's group

Lab of Industrializing Software Production is looking for volunteers to participate in brain waves analysis research experiments. The experiments are focused on understanding the relationship between programming and art such as drawing. The main aim is promotion of creative programming and the wellness of software developers. For participating in the research, minimal programming and basic drawing skills are required. Programming tasks in the experiments can be solved in a period of 45min and during the experiments participants are required to wear a brain waves reading device (Electroencephalograph). Requirements: - Programming experience in Python or C (this is not a hackaton, if you won't be able to finish all tasks, that would still be fine) - Willingness to do some drawing! - Language : English or Russian - 16 Experiment duration: 19.12 - 31.03 Time required: 1 hour Apply here For questions: gcinizwed

An international video competition Theme: Role of nuclear technology in addressing climate change. You can present the role of nuclear technology in addressing climate change: For you as individual, communities, regions, countries; Through inventions or technologies available with the peaceful atom; By identifying the benefits and disadvantages of nuclear power. You need to apply for participation here before 25 of December 2021. Stage 1 (until 31 January 2022): - Make a short description of the video (up to 300 words) and send it to the organizers. - The results of the first stage will be available until 28 February 2022. Stage 2 (until 20 March 2022): - If you have passed the first stage of the competition, you need to shoot a video (until 30 April 2022). Finalists of the competition will take part in the conference program in Moscow and receive awards from the State Atomic Energy Corporation "RosAtom" and the International Atomic Energy Agency in 13-16 of June 2022. Introducing the second master class of the InnoTalks. Gomoku: Above Tic-Tac-Toe, beyond Go The goal of this master class to acquaint attendees with history, rules and basic strategies in Gomoku. Gomoku is an ancient board game which was being developed and analyzed over centuries. Nowadays there are national leagues, clubs and championships in this game. The rules are simple, moreover, the game provides deep theory, strategies and vast number of openings. The application process for the 2022 Transport Grant has started! The Transport Grant competition was created to support active students in the Republic of Tatarstan and allows them to receive subsidies to cover transport costs. Grant amount: 8,000 rubles as one single payment, income tax: 13 for Russian citizens, 30 for foreign citizens. Conditions required for participation 1. A grade list only with ABP progress for the last semester and absence of academic debts (except for the 1st year students) 2. TIN (ИНН) 3. Diplomas for participation in academic and extracurricular activities 4. You can also apply as someone, who is in need, and can attach relevant proof. All documents and Up-to-date information on the competition can be found here Application deadline: 27 November, 23:59 The transport grant is also available for international students, but the grant providers have information only in Russian. Enter the group to ask any questions regarding the application process.

Winter Kila Tournament Kila (called "Russian Rugby") is the traditional old-Russian game in which two watagas (teams) try to bring the large leather ball into the opponent's "city" (a special zone of the playing filed). If you want to have fun, wallow in soft snow together with your opponents (or teammates if you are not so lucky), you are welcome! Each participant will be awarded by: 3 sports hours a good mood) Watch this video to get more information about Kila rules. Mobile University Platform "Mobile University" is an experimental platform for students of schools and universities, where they can develop creative skills for free, master modern professions and launch their own projects. Get the opportunity to develop in the field of youth policy and implement your ideas in the Republic of Tatarstan By participating in a six-month program Сandidates Pool (Кадровый резерв) you will be able to: pass a modern developmental program for free, which will help you create an individual development plan and determine your key skills; participate in powerful networking, find like-minded people and mentors who will help you to realize yourself faster; undergo an internship in organizations in the field of state youth policy. Infotelecom 2023 Russian student Olympiad Infotelecom is an annual Olympiad for bachelor students of 3-4 year, who major in Information and Computer Technologies. The main goal of the Olympiad is to identify students showing a high level of professional competencies in deepening knowledge in educational programs and motivated for professional development. Winners of the Olympiad will get a grant of the President of the Russian Federation 20 000 rubles a month until the end of their studies. Olympiad include 2 stages: 1) Preliminary round until February 15th 2) Final round March 2-3 More information here

static noise Beep ..omm check Comm check.. We have a connection! Transmit the message! Greetings, Earthlings! Did you know that we have an astrology astronomy, Space Club in Innopolis? Well, now you now. Our love for the vast beauty of space, fascination by heavy engineering of rockets, and dreams of interplanetary future for humankind united us into InnoSpaceClub. If your blood-pumping organ skipped a bit on one of those thing, we will be more than happy to see you at our gathering! This Sunday (5.02.23) 20:00 Room: 312 We'll play some KSP (Kerbal Space Program), make a mission control for the launches, chat about recent advancements in space exploration. You will be shown some astrodynamics' equations that we will apply to our rocket designs! In our plans for KSP: Make an orbital launch Build a space station Orbit the Mun Select the most appropriate time here (We might adjust the time of the event) and don't forget to bring snacks!

Information Security Projects Innopolis University invites you to take part in various information security projects. Currently, the University is implementing several programs: Interuniversity SOC. This program allows you to get training in the leading information security companies of the country, as well as gain experience in protecting real infrastructure. Cyber-laboratory "Innocyberpolygon" within the framework of the federal project "Advanced Engineering Schools". This project will allow you to participate in the development of a learning platform in which a student interacts with a dynamic virtual infrastructure that emulates entire computer networks. There is an opportunity to take part in current and future commercial projects of the Information Security Center of the University. Participation in these programs can give you the opportunity to gain practical experience in the field of information security, apply your knowledge to real scenarios and improve your resume and portfolio. The University is planning to organize an offline meeting to give you more details about the projects. If you would like to participate, please follow the link. Language: Russian

Youth Summit 2023 in India The Summit is organized by Federal Agency for Youth Affairs and Center for International Promotion Foundation. Topics of the Summit: Future of Work: Industry 4.O, Innovation 21st century skills Climate Change and Disaster Risk Reduction: Making Sustainability a Way of Life Building and Reconciliation: Ushering in an Era of No War Shared Future: Youth in Democracy and Governance Health, Wellbeing Sports: Agenda for Youth To participate you must: - be from 18 to 24 years old - be an expert in one of the 5 topics of the summit - have a high level of English - have a proactive attitude and experience in participating in international and Russian youth events and forums Deadline for application: February 12th Dates: from February 25th online format, from August 17 to 20th offline Place: Varanasi, India More information here

Youth bit Youth bit is a hackathon for talented IT specialists. Youth bit is your opportunity to: - work on real cases and compete for the prize fund - 1 million rubles - improve your IT skills - put a creative team together - get a support from the top experts Who can participate? Young people from any part of Russia, aged between 18 and 35. Deadline for registration: February 14th. More information here.

Intensive course "From an idea to a prototype" The project-based educational intensive course "From an idea to a prototype" is based on the University 2035 model. It is a format of practice-oriented education that combines teamwork on a technological project, learning along individual educational trajectories, and digital tools for managing the process based on data. The intensive lasts 3 months. Within the framework of this program, students work in interdisciplinary teams on projects that they have come up with themselves, or on tasks from customers (industrial companies). The goal of the team is to go from an idea to a working prototype. More information about the courses you can learn on the online webinar on February 15th at 2pm. More information here.

OSINT-meetup in Innopolis! How to always find what you are looking for on the web? To do this, you need to know how to search! OSINT is not taught at universities, but it is needed everywhere: from everyday issues to information security and all kinds of analytics. Join us to learn the secrets of search and discuss actual issues on the topic. Event's program: - reports from practitioners - OSINT village: workshop with task examples - informal part: live chat Meetup topics will be announced later. Event Language: Russian March 18, 14:00 Room 105 Channel Chat

The TriRAGEthlon event Feel like you're not good at math, but confident in your sword skills? Or maybe you've never held something like a blade in your life, but you're used to tearing your opponents apart on the chess battlefield? Or maybe all of the above seems ridiculous to you, because you're that all-powerful, pumped-up mathematician who believes that he has no equal? All these people have a chance to prove or to disprove themselves worthy here. Come and we'll find out, which opportunity will you actually take! The event will feature competitions in three disciplines at once: fencing, math, chess. Read more: Don't miss it! Time: Saturday, March 4th, 14:00 Place: main hall of the university If you want to participate, please register at Lichess and fill this form. For any questions, contact hamsterhom220

TGT Digital Challenge The registration for Hackathon is now open! What to expect? The season focuses on the problem of sand production in a wellbore, and your task is to recognize sand impacts in audio data that also contains water and gas noise. Who can participate? Students and young specialists in the field of data science or engineering over 18 years old. Participation is individual. Participants, prize-winners and winners will receive certificates, souvenirs and cash prizes. Registration is until March 26. Solutions can be submitted from March 27 to April 10 at 0:00 Moscow time. More information here. Still have questions - go here.

New Faculty Candidate Lecture Seminar! Lab of Industrializing Software Production is looking for volunteers to participate in brain waves analysis research experiments. The experiments are focused on understanding the relationship between programming and art artistic activities. The main aim is promotion of creative programming and the wellness of software developers. For participating in the research, minimal programming are required. Coding tasks in the experiments can be solved on your laptop in a period of 30-45min and during the experiments participants are required to wear a brain waves reading device (Electroencephalograph). Requirements: - Programming experience in Python, Java or C (this is not a hackaton, if you won't be able to finish all tasks, that would still be fine) - Familiar with drawing pictures (professional knowledge is not required) - Account on CodeForces - Laptop - Language : English or Russian - 16 Experiment duration: 30-45 min Apply : Link For questions: Guzelsafiullina1 or AlaaAldinHajjar

How should YOU dress for the Rock Ball? Rock is not just a genre of music, but also a special socio-cultural phenomenon Rock is the voice of youth, the musical embodiment of the contradictory moods tearing them apart, the conflict with common norms Rock is an expression of protest to existing norms, including the way a rocker dresses That's why the dress code of rockers is very various We have collected for you a selection of interesting attributes that relate to the rock theme: Outfits Make-ups Let's get this party started 18:00, 8 April, Saturday Main Hall of University

Open Source Contest Submission of applications for Open Source Contest has started! The contest is held by the Circle Movement of the National Technology Initiative (NTI). Applications for the contest are accepted in three tracks. In the "Creators" track, participants will publish their projects in public repositories (GitHub or GitLab). Track "Contributors" - for participants who have made a significant contribution to one of the existing open source or open hardware projects. The third track - "Implementation" - for projects containing a case and instructions for implementing open source solutions in the activities of an educational institution: school, college, university. In the "Contributors" direction, you can participate individually, in the other two - both individually and as a team. Register here until April 9th, 2023.

Project Contest "My country - my Russia" Perm National Research Polytechnic University and the organizing committee of the Big Intelligence accelerator are co-organizers of the Russian contest of youth projects "My Country - My Russia" in the "Big Technological Intelligence of My Country" nomination. The nomination "Great Technological Intelligence of My Country" includes projects aimed at developing technological entrepreneurship, science and technology in Russia, increasing the competitiveness of Russian industry and products created through the development and application of advanced technologies. To participate in the nomination participants may submit one or more projects. Opportunities for participants: - money prizes and valuable prizes for the creators of the best projects - grants for project implementation - invitation to internships and employment in partner companies - networking Apply here until March 30th.

XXVI Tupolev Readings Rectorate, Student Scientific Community and Research Council of A.N. Tupolev-KAI Kazan National Research Technical University (KNITU-KAI) invite you to participate in the International Youth Scientific Conference "XXVI Tupolev Readings (School of Young Scientists)", dedicated to the 100th anniversary of the foundation of civil aviation of Russia. The conference will focus on the issues and problems of aerospace technology, engineering, power, instrument-making, information, info-communication, radioelectronic technologies, as well as socio-economic aspects of the creation of aerospace technology. By the results of the conference a collection of conference papers in electronic form will be published. The collection will be assigned ISBN, УДК, and ББК codes. The texts of the reports will be placed in the Russian Science Citation Index (РИНЦ) system of the Scientific Electronic Library. During the section sessions 3 best papers of each section will be chosen and awarded with diplomas. Who can participate? Young scientists not older than 35. No registration fee. The conference will take place on November 9-10, 2023. To participate apply here until June 13th. More information about conditions of participation.

PROInterest online career guidance festival Participation in the Festival consists of the following steps: download or go to the web version of the Round mobile app go through the registration, be sure to indicate which educational institution you represent go to the festival page in the mobile app сhoose a thematic challenge you are interested in to participate in any contest you have to perform the task according to the instructions posted in the challange, and publish the project in photo- or video format in the column "Description of the project" indicate the name of the participant and give a brief description of the project to become the winner of the Festival, you need to perform the task and present your project. The winners of the festival are chosen by an expert group for each of the challenges The winners of the festival will receive valuable prizes, as well as the opportunity to take a paid internship in partner companies. ARCTECH Technology Competition Platform The ARCTECH technology competition platform was launched as part of Russia's chairmanship of the Arctic Council, with the participation of the Eastern State Planning Center, the Russian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and the Roscongress Foundation. Three contests have been announced for 2023, two of which are devoted to the search for applied developments and scientific research on topics related to the development of Russia's Arctic region. We invite you to take part in the following competitions: - ARCTECH ENGINEERING - ARCTECH SCIENTIFIC PITCH Deadline for application for both competitions - June 8th. The best participants who will make it to the finals will present their projects in front of a jury of experts on November 24, 2023. The total prize fund of the contests is 10 000 000 rubles

Biofabrication, Bioprinting and Project Activities The Foundation for Support of Innovation and Youth Initiatives of St. Petersburg together with Samara State Medical University of the Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation organizes the federal educational program "Biofabrication, Bioprinting and Project Activities". The program will run from May to October 2023 and will include: course of lectures by famous experts development of project ideas from participating teams competition in which participants will defend their projects As part of the training program, participants will learn 3D printing technologies based on biological materials, biological data processing, tissue modeling and design, and will be able to develop and submit a biotechnology project for the competition. Based on the results of the program, the best teams, which will take 1st, 2nd and 3rd place, will receive financial support for the implementation of projects from the organizers of the competition. The total prize fund is 1.5 million rubles and may be increased with additional sponsor support. To participate, apply here until May 19th.

International Petroleum Youth Forum The objective of the Forum is to create a unique international youth platform aimed at identifying and developing a progressive team of talented young people to solve urgent tasks faced by the fuel and energy complex of Russia and neighboring countries. Forum participants will undergo six days of intensive training, including sessions, master classes by leading oil and gas experts, and training sessions allowing them to take an active part in business challenges and case studies to find solutions and identify the most urgent problems. The best proposals and project ideas of the teams will receive financial and mentorship support. Who can participate? - 3-4 year bachelor students, master and PhD students - students with high academic rankings and individual achievements To participate, apply here until July 1st.

Inmotion Jarhead The Foundation for Support of Innovation and Youth Initiatives of St. Petersburg together with LLC "NC TECHNOSPARK" organizes two project schools Inmotion and Jarhead. Project schools will take place from July 12 to August 11, 2023 and will include a set of meetings-consultations with mentors, development of project ideas from participating teams, prototyping and competition, in which participants will present their projects. The format of the project schools is an intensive, which involves working in teams of 3-6 participants (including 2 engineers, 2 designers, 1 programmer and 1 technologist). Selection of participants will be based on portfolios and motivation letters. Participants of the Inmotion Design School will develop an updated industrial design for the Inmotion tracking system. Jarhead Design School participants will be tasked with developing an updated design for the JarHead concussion sensor. The winning team will receive a financial prize of 50000 To take part in Inmotion, apply here until July 9th. To participate in Jarhead, apply here until July 9th.

Vector of Success We invite you to take part in the Russian Festival of Science Popularization "Vector of Success". The Festival is supported by the grant of the Russian Ministry of Education and Science. The main objective of the Festival is to show that a scientific career can be an excellent way of self-realization and achieving success in life. Its competitive program is carried out on the platforms of the Festival in the form of online marathons for a wide audience. The finalists' tour will take place in September-October in Moscow and other Russian cities. The winners will receive valuable prizes. The Festival takes place from May till October 2023. If you're interested, register here. Contests are held in social networks: - VKontakte - Odnoklassniki - Telegram For more information, news and all updates, visit the Festival groups: - Dzen - RuTube

Youth Day Gas Forum What to expect? - professional orientation and identification of talented young people - discussion of current issues in the development of the energy industry - organization of an open dialogue with industry leaders and identifying new interaction models Who can participate? - master and PhD students - 35 years old and younger - high level of English (Upper-Intermediate) Steps to participate: 1. By July 7 apply here. 2. From July 10 to 12, 2023 each candidate will receive an individual assignment. 3. Candidates who successfully pass the selection test will be invited to the Virtual Academy for online training on energy topics. 4. Based on the results of the Virtual Academy training 30 best students will be selected, who will be invited to St. Petersburg to participate in the Youth Day events within the framework of the XII St. Petersburg International Gas Forum. Please, let us know if you're interested by filling out the form.

Youth Forum "Territory of Meanings" The 5th All-Russian Youth Forum "Territory of Meanings" of the platform "Rosmolodezh.Events" is the largest educational platform in Russia, which annually brings together young professionals from various industries from all over the country and is the central point for shaping the image of Russia's future through the eyes of young people. When? In 2023, the Forum is held from July 26 to September 2 and includes 8 shifts: "Think" (July 26 - 31) "Persuade" (July 31 - August 5) "Help" (August 5 - 10) "Create" (August 10 - 15) "Serve" (August 15 - 20) "Teach" (August 20 - 25) "Discover" (August 25 - 30) "Act" (August 30 - September 2) Where? Moscow region, Solnechnogorsk. More information here.

Acceleration Program for volunteers ДОБРО.РФ ДОБРО.РФ is Russia's largest platform where volunteers can find opportunities to help and organizers can find people willing to help. In addition, ДОБРО.РФ is an entire ecosystem of IT services for the development of creative civic activity. Now the applications for the Acceleration Program are being accepted! To participate in it, you need to submit an application on the website. Participants will receive 11 weeks of free online training where they will be able to get acquainted with the activities of the ДОБРО.ЦЕНТР. All information about the project can be found here. The deadline for registration is July 17.

IT's Tinkoff CTF Hacking Competition Can you hack the universe? And without flying outside of Innopolis? Sounds like a challenge! And we are sure that it can be met by all participants of IT's Tinkoff CTF hacking competition. 30 new dimensions, dozens of brave space teams and only two days to complete all missions and get the maximum number of points. What awaits at the end? The best will receive universal honor and cash prizes up to 360,000 rubles! By the way, the missions will be interesting not only for information security engineers, but also for developers, SREs and QAs, analysts and other IT specialists. We will go to conquer the multiverse on July 15 and 16. You can participate both online and in person in your city in the Tinkoff IT Hub. Quizzes, board games, cool merchandise and networking with experts are waiting for offline participants. More information here.

X International Forum of Technoprom-2023 By Presidential Decree in the Russian Federation was declared the Decade of Science and Technology. One of the milestone events of the Decade in 2023 will be the X International Forum of Technological Development. The program includes more than 200 face-to-face, online and hybrid events. Technoprom-2023 will include an exhibition of technological development, which will present the leaders of the national rating of scientific and technological development, stands of state corporations and development institutes, as well as international and domestic companies, and demonstrate the achievements of domestic science and high-tech industry. The Technoprom-2023 Forum will be held in the format of the Russian Science and Technology Week from August 22 to 25 in Novosibirsk. To participate, please apply here until July 15th.

Phygital Basketball in Innopolis! On July 8, the student basketball club held the first 3x3 phygital basketball tournament in Innopolis. Phygital sport is a spectacular combination of traditional sports and their digital analogues. Participants played matches in two stages: the match started on the game console and continued on the parquet. This trend is actively developing across the country, and in 2024 Kazan will host the international tournament "Games of the Future". Students and staff of our University took part in the tournament. According to the results of the matches, the team of employees won! Congratulations to all participants of the tournament! Photos from the tournament can be found at the here. And now we offer you to watch a video, prepared by the club coach - Danila Khasanov.

FINOdays Online Hackathon The FINOdays hackathon is a team competition on developing fintech services and applications for young professionals aged 18-30 from Russia and EAEU countries. It has been held by the Bank of Russia as part of the Youth Program of the FINOPOLIS Innovative Financial Technologies Forum since 2017. Participants solve financial sector challenges with the support of the largest players in the fintech market. In 2023, the hackathon will be held in 5 technological areas: biometrics, distributed registry technology and digital financial assets, artificial intelligence and machine learning, open APIs, and payment services. The best projects based on the results of the hackathon will be selected by partner companies for further development of services and will be presented at the exhibition of the FINOPOLIS 2023 Innovative Financial Technologies Forum. To participate, apply here until July 24th. Prize fund is 1 700 000.

Dear students, we invite you to take part in the exciting event Science Slam Science Slam is a battle of scientists. Start of the traditional weekly maths seminar The seminar is organised to support students who wants to: - participate in math olympiads for students, or - participate in upcoming Integration Bee which will be announced soon, or - improve hisher math skills in those areas of mathematics that are not taught at the University. Here are some topics to cover: 1. Group theory: groups, permutations, morphisms, factor groups, and also solvable groups and introduction to Galois theory, i.e. why there is no quintic formula and why there is no way to trisect an angle with a ruler and a compass? 2. Basics of topology, i.e. what do a cup and a ball have in common? 3. Complex analysis, i.e. what is the difference between imaginary unit and sqrt-1? 4. And more If you are interested join this chat to see more info and to attend meetings. See you soon!

Global software Analysis Competition 2023 GSAC 2023 welcomes individuals and teams of up to 4 members to join the ranks of those who champion cybersecurity, shape the digital landscape, and secure the future of technology. Goal: Teams or individual experts are required to develop a static analysis tool utilizing the LLVM compiler infrastructure. Additionally, the KLEE symbolic execution engine may be used. The primary objective of the tool should be the detection of memory leaks, buffer overflows, and use-after-free errors. Show your analysis skills and win up to 14,000 Dates: 15 September - 1 December - Main contest 15 December - Awarding ceremony More information and registration here Deadline: 15 September 12:00

InnoGoClub Meeting! What is Go? Go is an ancient asian board game that involves strategy, tactics, and creative thinking. It's played by two players who take turns placing black and white stones on a grid. The goal is to capture territory and strategically outmaneuver your opponent. It's simple to learn, yet incredibly deep and challenging, making it a game that offers endless possibilities and excitement. Get ready for an exciting evening of Go game strategy, friendship and fun! The InnoGoClub is proud to invite all university students and Go enthusiasts to a club meeting where we will come together to play, learn and enjoy the fascinating game of Go, whether you are a beginner or a seasoned player. Date: Saturday, 16th September Location: Room 305 Time: 19:00 Join our InnoGoClub for a fantastic time of Go game action and good company. See you there!

Become a participant of the ICPC stage - the student team Programming World Championship! The "Tabletop Role Playing Games" Club invites veterans of the genre, long-time gamemasters, newcomers, and anyone else interested to the first introductory meeting. All-Russian Olympiad of students "I am a professional" The Olympiad "I am a professional" is not a test of knowledge and not a competition. This is a social elevator that helps to build a career. Tasks prepared by experts from Russian companies and universities are intended for senior students of bachelor's, specialist's and master's degrees. You will receive: - Benefits for admission to master's or postgraduate studies at leading Russian universities - The opportunity to enter the national personnel base "I am a professional" and undergo an internship in a large profile company. Date: October 16, 2023 to December 15, 2023 Why take the course? - Successful completion of the course guarantees a job in a startup studio as a JPM - Easy to combine with your studies - Training is free of charge - The course will help you learn how to build startups and improve business ideas - Provides an opportunity to work out in a company in Innopolis (for Innopolis students) - Practice and feedback from experts - Combination of theory and practice, development of flexible skills and elements of product thinking - Provides information, tools and practice to launch a project - Workshops to develop teamwork - Closed learning chat for support and experience sharing - Training on packaging the project for the investor - Access to additional tools and resources - All training materials are available to take from mobile devices - Access to the course is retained for one year What will you be able to do at the end of the course? - Formulate a project hypothesis - Analyze competitors - Conduct custdev: prepare scripts and conduct interviews with respondents, segment TA - Prepare reports and maintain project documentation - Calculate unit economics - Prepare an offer for TA - Package the product for the investor Join the course here Language: Russian

Visual systems - with the help of students The report describes the Laboratory of Visual Systems of IPPI RAS and scientific-applied projects over the last 10 years. Key themes of the projects are image processing and technical vision (including computed tomography), as well as topics related to the study of the human visual system. The lab collaborates with leading universities, therefore teams include students to more than half. The talk will also include a discussion of some of the Laboratory's scientific achievements that underlie its applications, as well as the general principles that we believe allow us to produce world-class results in vision and recognition systems in a repeatable manner. Bio: Dmitry Nikolaev Obtained his masters degree in 2000 and Ph.D. (in applied math) in 2004 at the MSU. Obtained Sc.D. degree (in tech) in 2023 at MIPT. Head of the Vision Systems Lab at the Institute for Information Transmission Problems RAS since 2007. Associate professor in the MIPT. Co-founder of several successful hi-tech companies. His research activities are in the areas of computer vision and image processing with focus on the computationally effective algorithms. October 31, 13.00-14.30 Room 304 To join, just click the link in Yandex.Telemost

Contour invites you to a Technoquiz! Technoquiz is a quiz on IT-related topics. To participate, you only need ingenuity and intelligence. You gather a team of friends and colleagues and compete with other participants. Everyone is in a good mood and in good spirits, and the winners receive gifts. What are the rules? Standard for quizzes. There will be 7 rounds, 40 questions. This is 2.5-3 hours including breaks. Participation is free, you must register! How to participate? 14th annual Workshop on Program Semantics, Specification and Verification Russian verification hackathon VeHa On November 3-4, 2023, our University hosted the 14th annual Workshop on Program Semantics, Specification and Verification. At the seminar there were speakers from Irkutsk, Novosibirsk, Barnaul, Kazan, Moscow, Spain and, of course, Innopolis. Find more information: the Program and materials and about seminar. But most importantly, on November 2-5, within the framework of PSSV-23, the first Russian verification hackathon VeHa was held! VeHa was an online program verification competition. VeHa diploma recipients include students from Innopolis, St. Petersburg State Technical University and Novosibirsk state university. Bars Group was a partner of the competition (providing gifts to competition winners). Find more information: the regulations, tasks and results. Next year Innopolis University is planning to host PSSV-24 and the VeHa-24 hackathon.

Intercollegiate festival "International Student's Day - 2023" The festival "Day of the Foreign Student" is aimed at involving foreign students of Tatarstan universities in the creative and cultural life of our republic, faster and more successful socialization in modern Russian society. The age of the participant is up to 35 years. Nominations: - Vocals (Pop; Folklore; Academic) - Music (Instrumental solo performance; Vocal and instrumental ensemble; Beat-box) - Dance (Pop; Folklore; Classical; Hip-hop) - Theater (Student Theater of variety miniatures; Artistic reading) - Original genre (Circus; Pantomime; Fashion Theater). Timeline: Stage I. Qualifying stage. Date: November 20-21, 2023. Venue: GBU "House of Friendship of the Peoples of Tatarstan", Pavlyukhina str., 57. Stage II. Gala concert of the Festival. A useful free online resource Culture.RF is a portal about the culture of Russia. It tells about interesting and significant events and people in the history of literature, architecture, music, cinema, theater, as well as about folk traditions and monuments of the peoples of Russia. The portal publishes articles, photos, quotes and reference notes, etc There are 11 sections, each of which is dedicated to a specific direction in the field of culture: "Cinema", "Museums", "Music", "Theater", "Literature", "Traditions", "Architecture", "Education", as well as sections "Special Projects", "Live" and "Afisha", uniting all directions Materials of any section can be used to organize events Subscribe to the channel

Forum "Strong Ideas for a New Time" The purpose of the forum is to select and implement strong ideas that will make a significant contribution to strengthening Russia's sovereignty and achieving the country's strategic development goals. Participation in the forum will allow the leaders of ideas to finalize their initiatives, find partners for their implementation, as well as receive comments from relevant experts. The initiators will personally present the best ideas and projects to the head of state. Topics for the selection of ideas: - The development of unmanned technologies. - International cooperation in the scientific and technological field. - Development of domestic technological competencies and import substitution and others topics. Application deadline: January 31, 2024 More information

"Path of the Future" Olympiad "Group Astra" has proudly become the gold partner for the 9th edition of the "Path of the Future" Olympiad. This season, they're presenting IT-oriented tasks in the realm of Astra Linux OS administration within the business category. Participants in two age groups (13-17 and 18-23 years old) should undergo 3 stages of testing: complete an online test of 30 questions; familiarize yourself with the preparatory course in absentia and pass online tests on it on the Astra Linux platform; complete the technical task for setting up a computer network on Astra Linux virtual machines in video conferencing mode under the supervision of an observer. Winners and runners-up, chosen by a panel of certified IT experts, will receive a vendor's certificate and an invitation for an interview for a subsequent internship at the "Astra Group." More Information:

New regulations on the Innopoints student incentive program! Innopolints Program Goal: support events, manage administrative tasks, encourage volunteering and promote strong student community development. New Year New People We are glad to announce the recruitment for SU: Internship This year we decided to split the SU into two parts - Active and Core. Active: 7-10 people who are involved in creative work (photographers, designers, event organizers, etc.). Active interns will spend the next semester implementing their projects or volunteering at various events so that we can assess their abilities and willingness to work Apply for SU-Active: Internship Core: people who deal with solving students' problems, holding meetings with the administration etc. Core interns will be required to be interviewed by current SU team to identify their interests and get their suggestions for improving students' life Apply for SU-Core: Internship Deadline: February 1st

MTS Camp Action Students together with MTS have created the MTS Camp campus. This is a unique opportunity for students to gain skills and practical experience, get into a large company for a paid internship and get a job at one of the largest companies in the country. The campus will host master classes, intensive sessions with experts from MTS and interactive quests, which will immerse you in real work situations and help you practice. Students of 3-4 years of bachelor's degree and 1-2 years of master's degree can take part in the campus. Participants, finalists and winners will receive certificates and diplomas. The winners will receive valuable gifts from MTS. Dates of the first stream: from February 12 to March 3 Regions: Moscow, Novosibirsk, Nizhny Novgorod, Kazan, Voronezh and Yekaterinburg More information

Design and educational intensive "From idea to prototype" The design and educational intensive "From idea to prototype" according to the University model 2035 is a format of practice-oriented education that combines teamwork on a technological project, training on individual educational trajectories and digital tools for databased process management. The intensive lasts for 3 months. Within the framework of this program, students work in interdisciplinary teams on projects that they have come up with themselves, or on tasks from customers (industrial companies). The goal of the team is to come from an idea to a working prototype. More information

All-Russian Scientific and Practical Conference named after Zhores Alferov The purpose of the Conference is the formation of the country's human resources potential. This is realized by consolidating the efforts of enterprises in the real sector of the economy, the state, fundamental and academic sciences aimed at finding, supporting and developing talented youth, taking into account the request of existing enterprises. Stages: - Qualifying (correspondence) stage. - Final (face-to-face) stage. Directions: - IT technologies and exact sciences, including innovation in IT; - Physics and Astronomy; - Engineering, technology and instrumentation, including cyberphysical and aerospace systems and complexes, innovation in the industry; - And many others. Registration deadline: 10.09.2024 More information: VK, official website

Volunteer channel and chat for Innopolis University students Do you want to earn Innopoints? Upgrade your soft and hard skills? Have a great time with 319? All-Russian Open Source Project Competition The competition is an open source entry platform for students and schoolchildren. Participants will have to publish their own project or make a significant contribution to the development of one of the existing open source developments. The best participants of the competition will receive expertise from representatives of leading technology companies, will be able to prepare an article about the project for publication and participate in the selection for paid internships. Registration deadline: March 1, 2024 More information

Get a chance to be a part of the first ever Games of the Future! Kazan is preparing to become the epicenter of a unique competition, where everyone will be able to take part in open qualification in two exciting disciplines: Dance simulator and VR rhythm simulator. Competitions are a celebration for everyone who lives by dancing, who seeks harmony and precision in every movement. Educational program "ESG, sustainable development and climate change" The course is suitable for anyone who wants to learn: - What is the difference between the concepts of sustainable development and ESG. - How do they affect the work of companies. - How to build a career in the field of sustainable development. The teachers of the course are the management and experts of the Bank of Russia, university professors, government representatives, experts from financial organizations and leading companies in the field of sustainable development. The training takes place online on the platform of the University of the Bank of Russia, you can join it at any time. The course includes 16 lectures, final testing and webinars. After completing the course, students will receive certificates. More information

The championship "Olympiad for the first" Championship is a federal intellectual championship for bachelors of 3-4 courses, masters of 1-2 courses and university graduates. This is not only a competition among business solution development teams, but also a unique educational course from experts in the field of management and telecommunications. The theme of the Olympiad in 2024 will be the concept of a "Smart City". Under the guidance of mentors from MegaFon, teams will have to develop high-tech solutions using artificial intelligence. Directions: - Engineering, - IT, - Big Data, - finance, - marketing, - management. The winners will receive cash prizes of up to 250,000 rubles, letters of recommendation from the heads of MegaFon and GSOM St. Petersburg State University, career advice from experts, a chance to pass an accelerated selection for an internship and get into the personnel reserve of MegaFon. Registration deadline: March 1, 2024 More information

Bootcamp on sports programming Course on sports programming for coaches Bootcamp: Bootcamp will provide an opportunity for students to improve their algorithmic thinking skills, learn to work in a team and solve complex problems. The course will enhance programming skills, teach how to handle big data, boost competitiveness, improve understanding of algorithms and data structures, and expand knowledge in programming. Coaches can also discover new training methods and problem-solving approaches. More information

Dear students, As part of the Job Fair OMP company, the developer of Aurora OS announces collection of applications for mini-CTF in Jeopardy format on Aurora OS. During 4 hours you are invited in teams of up to 4 people to search for vulnerabilities in applications for your mobile device. You will be expected to complete several small tasks on topics such as cryptography, reverse and forensics, flavored with the specifics of the Aurora OS. Each team will be given a prepared device for 4 hours and 3 tasks. All participants will not leave without merch and new interesting knowledge. A unique opportunity to try to "tinker" with mobile OS :) March 15 14:30 - 18:30 Registration until 04.03.2024 Registered teams will be sent materials for preparation Language: Russian

15 scholarships of the Academy of Sciences of the Republic of Tatarstan to support students who have proved themselves in studies and science Participate: bachelors and masters Term: for 1 semester Amount: 6000 rub. per month Competition for participation: - grades of "4" and "5" for the whole period ("5" not less than 50) - Competition work that has not previously been awarded a scholarship, prize, other award or grant Docs for participation: 1. research paper in the form of a scientific project 2. an annotation of the research paper 3. review of the research advisor 4. the result of intellectual activity (patent, certificate, program product, technological development, etc.) (if available) 5. a grade list 6. list of publications in a scientific edition (if available) 7. list of public presentation of the results of the research work at a conference, seminar (if available) Deadline: March 1 All documents must be submitted to room 319 More information in the Regulations

The International Championship "Battle of Robots" - new season! Battle of Robots is a spectacular championship and an international platform for the exchange of experience in the field of robotics. Inventors and the best technologies from all over the world meet to show their skills and compete for the total prize fund. Disciplines: "Battle of robots". For teams from 1 to 5 people. The robot's dimensions are up to 150x150x200 cm, the robot's weight is up to 110 kg. "The battle of the mini-robots." For teams from 1 to 5 people aged 10 to 17 years a mentor over the age of 18.The dimensions of the robot are 25x25x25 cm, the robot's weight is up to 1.5 kg. Prize fund: 6 million rub May - December 2024 Register here, more info: VK Registration deadline: March 10

II Festival of Technological Entrepreneurship "Technocode" The purpose of the festival is to build a long-term partnership between university student teams and leaders of the Russian technology business. During the festival, student teams will be able to create their own project, and subsequently a technology startup, focusing from the very beginning on the real demands and needs of partner companies. Within the framework of the festival, the "speed dating" zone will be held - this is a unique opportunity to personally present your project to a real investor. To do this, a selection of startups corresponding to the fifth level of technology readiness will be carried out in advance. You can take part in the festival in an online format. The cases, as well as the quiz, will be available online. The meeting with investors will be held in person in Moscow. Date: April 17, 2024 More information

Online case-championship Adventure League The Adventure League is a large-scale case championship for students of all undergraduate and graduate courses, as well as graduates of 2022-2023. Participants will receive: - improving their skills and abilities; - close interaction with representatives of Sovcombank; - the possibility of an internship at Sovcombank; - an entertaining event at the end of the case championship. The total prize fund is 400,000 rubles, which will be divided among the winners. More information and registration

Listen to 200 IT reports from large companies at the "Stachka" conference The student startup Torox, together with the "Stachka", is holding an event. On April 12-13, the conference will be held in Ulyanovsk (UlSPU). Speakers: specialists from Yandex, Odnoklassniki, VK, Samokat.tech, Alfa Bank, Avito, Ozon and other companies. The program includes 50 sections within 6 areas (development, digital marketing, management, IT in industries, design and content, startups). Send a photo of the student ID to the post office salesnastachku.ru or in a Telegram chat 2. Wait for a message from the organizers we will send you a promo code for a 90 discount; 3. Enter the promo code on the website and pick up the ticket at the lowest price. At the "Stachka", the best companies will offer many vacancies and internships in various IT specialties. And if you are no longer a student, take the promo code for a 15 discount "Innopolis15". Tickets are available here

Join Our AgriTech Startup Team for Paid Internship! Are you passionate about revolutionizing the agricultural industry through innovative technology? We're a dynamic AgriTech startup seeking talented Frontend, Backend, and Game Developers to join our team and help reshape the future of farming. As a member of our team, you'll have the exciting opportunity to rework an existing web application, enhancing its functionality, user experience, and overall impact in the agricultural sector. Our project aims to empower farmers with cutting-edge tools and insights to to increase production and provide new distribution channels.. Roles Available (at least middle level): Frontend Developer: Utilize your expertise in TypeScript, React, Apollo Client, Storybook, Styled Components, and modern frontend frameworks to create intuitive and visually stunning user interfaces. Backend Developer: Harness the power of server-side technologies like Node.js, TypeScript, NestJS, Apollo Server, TypeOrm to build robust and scalable backend systems that drive our AgriTech platform. Game Developer: Bring creativity and innovation to the table as you develop engaging game in Unity to make using our platform a fun and rewarding experience for customers. 2D Artist: Utilize your artistic skills to create visually appealing graphics, icons, and illustrations that enhance the aesthetics and usability of our farming game. Requirements: Strong experience in web development (Frontend, Backend, or Game Development). Familiarity with Agile methodologies and version control systems (e.g., Git). Desire to make a positive impact on global food production. Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset. Join us in our mission to revolutionize agriculture and empower farmers worldwide! If you're ready to take on an exciting challenge and be part of a passionate team driving meaningful change, apply now by contacting navruza_tulkunova in telegram

Research of psychological well-being and intercultural experience of students This study is conducted by employees of the Department of Psychology of the Higher School of Economics and takes the form of an anonymous online survey. During the research, you will be asked to fill out several questionnaires about well-being, creativity, motivation, experience of intercultural communication and the use of foreign languages in studies and everyday life. The answers will help in the development of scientific ideas about the factors of psychological well-being and the development of programs for psychological support of students. The execution time will take no more than 30 minutes. Participants need to know Russian. Link to the survey

Our all-Russian game development lab has started accepting applications It's time to participate in Game Open Lab a month of intense game creation. You can expect an immersive industry format and a prize of 300,000 rubles!! The lab will consist of three stages: Online game jam from June 10th to 17th: We form teams of up to 5 people and create games under the leadership of the most effective producer in Russia Finalists determination stage from June 18th to July 4th: Prepare pitches, watch streams of games created by top-notch gaming bloggers and developers Offline final in Innopolis from July 6th to 8th We pitch the best projects to the most unbiased jury, participate in lectures and master classes by industry representatives Registration until June 9th Organizers Innopolis University and the GDE game development community with the support of Sberbank.

Journey into Science: Insights from our alumni Vlad Kurenkov Join us for an inspiring talk with our alumnus, Vlad Kurenkov, Head of the Adaptive Agents group at the Artificial Intelligence Research Institute. Summer School of Financial Mathematics Quanton The theme of the event is to get acquainted with the life of a mathematical model in an investment bank. For a whole week, you will immerse yourself in the work of quanta and find out which way the model goes from construction to validation. And you will also be able to: get acquainted with recognized Russian and international experts from science and industry; learn how to build and validate models in Python; understand how and why to evaluate derivatives; communicate with like-minded people; evaluate your strength in a team competition at the end of the training. Students of 2-4 courses can take part. Registration deadline: July 1st Dates: July 14th - 21st Venue: Pushkin city More information

Hackathon for robotics programmers Registration for the most spectacular and technically equipped competition of the Rosneft IT Marathon has opened. Teams of up to 4 people over the age of 18 can take part. The hackathon will take place in three stages: 1. The correspondence qualifying stage - the development of the concept of a robotic solution with a description of the principle of operation. 2. The correspondence stage of implementation is software development, assembly and debugging of a robotic installation. The funds for the creation of the solution are provided by the organizers. 3. The face-to-face final is a demonstration of the developed solution. Prize fund: 700,000 rubles More information

Inter-regional competitions "CyberSibir 2024" The format of the competition is attack-defense. Each team will receive a server from the jury with a pre-installed set of vulnerable services. The tasks of the participants are to maintain their services in working order, prevent intrusion attempts and carry out attacks on the servers of other teams in order to "capture flags". The team receives points for sending the received "flags" to the jury server. Registration deadline: June 26 Dates of the event: from October 31 to November 1, 2024

The conference will also include professional networking with experts from BARS Group, a job fair and the distribution of memorable gifts. Students of 2-4 courses are invited to participate, for this you need to fill out the Google form by clicking on the link. Date: September 9th Venue: Kazan

Science time from Kamzolov Dmitry Kamzolov Dmitry works as a researcher at the Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence (Abu Dhabi, UAE) . Dmitry graduated from the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology in 2018, and defended his Ph.D. thesis in 2020. His main research focus is second and higher order optimization methods and quasi-Newton methods for contour and non-convex optimization. Additionally, he works on adaptive stochastic methods, distributed optimization, federated learning, and various applications. He will share his research and tell how to write scientific articles 11 July, 18:00 Language: English Online - we will send link later Fill form to participate

XV annual seminar in the series Program Semantics, Specification and Verification: Theory and Applications" (PSSV) Throughout the history of the seminar, Kazan and Innopolis have repeatedly hosted it. Добро пожаловать в новый учебный год! У тебя когда-нибудь были идеи, которые ты мечтал воплотить в реальный бизнес? Есть проект, который мог бы изменить мир, но не знаешь, с чего начать? Или ты уже ищешь деньги на реализацию, но не знаешь, где их взять? Тогда Стартап-студия это место, где твои мечты станут реальностью! Что такое Стартап-студия? Это пространство, где студенты могут развивать свои идеи в настоящие стартапы. Здесь ты получишь опыт наставников, индивидуальное сопровождение, мотивирующее комьюнити и информационную поддержку, которая поможет на каждом этапе пути: от поиска идеи до привлечения инвесторов. Мы поддерживаем студентов на всех этапах: Мозговой штурм Поможем найти и оценить идеи, которые потенциально могут стать успешными проектами. Прототипирование Научим разрабатывать MVP и тестировать гипотезы. Привлечение инвестиций Подскажем, как найти финансирование для твоего стартапа и представить его инвесторам. Почему тебе стоит прийти к нам? Опыт наставников: сотрудники нашей студии поделятся своим опытом и подскажут, как избежать ошибок. Сообщество единомышленников: ты не одинок вокруг тебя будут другие студенты, которые тоже работают над своими проектами. Реальные результаты: студенты нашей студии уже запускали свои стартапы и привлекали инвестиции ты можешь быть следующим! Начни свой путь к успеху уже сегодня! Загляни к нам на консультацию, даже если у тебя пока нет четкой идеи мы поможем сгенерировать ее вместе. Все великие проекты начинались с одного маленького шага, и этот шаг ты можешь сделать прямо сейчас. Запишись на консультацию тут, тык Не упусти шанс изменить свое будущее и мир вокруг! Мы ждем именно тебя! English version

Welcome to attend "Innopolis. Science" seminar on September, 5 Lecture: "Research frontier in the area of large language models" Sergei Markov will talk about the progress in the field of large linguistic and multimodal models over the last 10 years, the challenges currently facing their developers, and the main research trends. The expert will also share his thoughts on if further development of large language models will lead to the creation of Artificial general intelligence (AGI) systems. Sergey Markov is Managing Director, Head of the Department of Experimental Machine Learning Systems, Sberbank's Salut Shared Services Division. A specialist in the field of artificial intelligence, organizes and performs operational, strategic and scientific and methodological management of the processes of development, implementation and maintenance of experimental software and hardware systems based on machine learning technologies. Author of the chess program SmarThink, champion of Russia among chess programs in 2004, CIS champion in 2005, founder of the popular science portal 22century.ru, author of a number of popular science lectures on machine learning and artificial intelligence, author of the book A wild electric sheep chase: The Big Book of Artificial Intelligence. September 5, 16:20 - 17:50 Language: Russian Location: Room 107 Join online

We're calling to join the International Cybersecurity Games, an independent competition for students and high schoolers studying Хэштегcybersecurity! Youll gain real-world experience by working on realistic infrastructure, meet industry experts, and connect with like-minded peers. Plus, its a great way to build your skills, enhance your portfolio, and even score an internship. How to join: Get your attack or defense team together and sign up by September 16, 2024: Complete the selection process by tackling practical challenges until October 14, 2024. The grand finale of the fall season is the student Standoff Cyberbattle. Red teams (white-hat hackers) attack virtual states, while blue teams (defenders) detect and respond to threats, sharpening their skills in a real-world setting. The Code of Consent hackathon is a large-scale competition for experienced and novice IT professionals. Solve a real business problem and win a prize of 1,000,000 rubles! Register by September 27th: We invite Frontend and Backend developers; analysts, Product managers, designers, testers, students and graduates of technical universities. The organizer of the hackathon is the insurance company "Consent". The company has been on the market for more than 30 years and is one of the top 10 insurers in Russia. Hackathon participants can choose from one of the tasks based on real business cases of Soglasie Insurance Company: A web service for testing hypotheses. In a saturated insurance market, companies are constantly looking for new ways to attract customers. This requires rapid testing of various hypotheses and ideas. Your task in this track is to develop a web service that will allow you to create and test new insurance products. This service should help companies quickly test the effectiveness of various hypotheses by creating digital insurance products with minimal time and resources. A service for project management. In a large company with many projects, information about them is often scattered across various systems and formats. This leads to difficulties in management, lack of transparency and loss of time to search for relevant data. Your task in this track is to develop a web service for centralized storage, convenient display and monitoring of large projects within the company. What awaits the participants at the hackathon? Solving a real business problem from a large insurance company Communicating with experts and getting feedback Meetups, check points, final presentation and award ceremony Timeline of the hackathon "Code of Consent": September 27 at 23.59 completion of registration. On September 28 at 12.00 the opening of the hackathon and the publication of tasks. On September 28 at 12.30 the opening meetup, experts will tell you more about the tasks. On September 30 at 19.00 the first checkpoint. On October 3 at 19.00 intermediate checkpoint. On October 5 at 14.00 the final check point. October 5 at 20.00 the end of uploading projects. October 6 at 12.00 announcement of the finalists. On October 6 at 14.00 pitchings of the authors of the best projects. On October 6 at 20.00 the award ceremony for the winners. Do not miss the largescale competition - join the hackathon "Code of Consent":

Student Hackathon "HackAtom" This is an online hackathon for university students, young and ambitious developers and information security specialists. You can take part in a team of up to 4 people, or alone. The hackathon assignment is related to the AtomSkills championship movement at the state corporation Rosatom. Already, we have several dozen vulnerable services that specialists use for training: - A social network site where you can get a username and password from the Administrator through a regular SQL injection in the account search. - Git repository, where the vulnerable CICD was configured incorrectly and can be poisoned by downloading the pipeline. - FreeIPA with an incorrectly configured access policy, where you can get administrator privileges through a Keytab stolen from a neighboring machine. Paid internships for the best teams, memorable prizes and awards. Registration deadline: until September 21st Dates: from September 23 to October 18 More information

Welcome to attend "Innopolis. Science" seminar on September, 30 Lecture: "Introduction to Non-Smooth Optimization" This lecture will explore non-smooth optimization problems, which are crucial in data analysis but can't be solved with standard calculus techniques. We'll examine key examples like LASSO regression and low-rank matrix recovery, discussing their benefits in handling overfitting and data anomalies. We'll delve into the theory of subgradients and numerical methods for solving these problems, highlighting their unique features. Finally, we'll discuss recent advancements and propose topics for potential collaborative research projects. Fedor Sergeevich Stoniakin - Dr. Sci. (Physics and Mathematics), Leading Researcher at the Laboratory of Advanced Combinatorics and Network Applications, MIPT, Head of the Department of Algebra and Functional Analysis, Physics and Technical Institute of the V.I. Vernadsky Crimean Federal University. September 30, 17:40 - 18:50 Language: Russian Location: Room 106 Join Online

Open Lecture for Faculty and Students by Fyodor Stonyakin: "Introduction to Nonsmooth Optimization" as part of the seminar "Innopolis. Science." Fyodor Sergeevich Stonyakin - Doctor of Physical and Mathematical Sciences, Senior Researcher at the Laboratory of Advanced Combinatorics and Network Applications of MIPT, Head of the Department of Algebra and Functional Analysis at the Physical-Technical Institute of the Crimean Federal University named after V.I. Vernadsky. The lecture will cover the following topics: Optimization problems, involving finding maxima or minima, are frequently encountered and are introduced as early as school, during the study of derivatives. However, the apparatus of derivatives (or gradients, in the case of multivariable functions) is not suitable for all optimization problems. For example, the objective function for finding the minimal radius sphere covering a given set of points is non-differentiable at an infinite number of points. In this lecture, we will review examples of well-known nonsmooth optimization problems related to data analysis (such as LASSO regression and the problem of recovering a low-rank matrix with a non-Euclidean quality metric). These approaches can be useful in combating overfitting and addressing the instability of the standard least squares method in the presence of data anomalies or outliers. We will discuss key concepts from subgradient theory and numerical methods for solving nonsmooth optimization problems, highlighting some of their fundamental characteristics. In conclusion, we will briefly touch upon some contemporary works in this field and suggest topics for possible collaborative research (including course and thesis projects). September 30, 17:4018:50 Location: Room 106 Language: Russian VK livestream: (

Technological competition "Автономный поиск. Софт" Competition is aimed at creating a solution for unmanned aircraft that will allow you to search for missing people in a sparsely populated area. Participants are invited to develop software to search for people on aerial photographs taken using UAVs: a training dataset and a platform for downloading trained models will be provided, which will be run for calculation on Jetson single-board computers. Why participate? - Improve your skills in Machine Learning and Computer Vision - contribute to the solution of a socially significant task - declare yourself through a competition and find partners, customers, investors - test your achievements on the infrastructure of the contest After forming the leaderboard and determining the winners, the best software will be able to be tested in conditions close to a real search operation. The prize fund of the contest amounts to 25 million rubles. Registration deadline: November 2 More information

Антон Скударнов, выпускник УИ 2020 года, проведет лекцию о карьере в геймдизайне! Антон со-основатель игрового стартапа Indie GameDev Club, организатор Innopolis Global Game Jam IGD Con, геймдизайнер и продакт-менеджер с опытом работы в индустрии более 5 лет. Антон расскажет, как с нуля начать путь в геймдизайне, как правильно составить портфолио, чтобы оно зацепило работодателей, и почему айтишники имеют конкурентное преимущество в этой сфере. Когда: 21 октября (понедельник) 17:30 Где: Аудитория 313, университет Иннополис Anton Skudarnov, a 2020 graduate of Innopolis University, will give a lecture on a career in game design! Anton is the co-founder of the indie game startup Indie GameDev Club, the organizer of the Innopolis Global Game Jam IGD Con, and a game designer and product manager with over 5 years of experience in the industry. He will discuss how to start a career in game design from scratch, how to create a portfolio that grabs employers' attention, and why IT professionals have a competitive advantage in this field. When: October 21 (Monday) at 5:30 PM Where: Auditorium 313, Innopolis University Language: The slides will be in English, and the language of the lecture will be determined based on the participants.

Access to the Booking system is now open! Students can now use our resources for their AI projects through the Booking system, available at the link: How does it work? You can reserve up to 14 of an A100 80Gb GPU for your AI tasks. Access to resources will be provided via a unique link after booking. Each user gets 20 GB of storage in the persistent_volume folder. Using points Each booking deducts some of your virtual points. Points are automatically restored a week after the booking. Need more resources? If you need more points, resources, or anything else, you can submit a request through your profile, and well review it. Happy using the resources for your projects! Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or issues.

Scholarships of the President of the Russian Federation and scholarships of the Government of the Russian Federation These scholarships are intended to support and recognise students who have shown outstanding abilities in academic and scientific activities, one of the most prestigious scholarships in Russia. Requirements for applicants: - within 2 semesters preceding the competition, grades of excellent (more than 50) and good, no academic arrears for the entire period of study - scientific publications andor victories in competitions, olympiads, festivals and other scientific, scientific-technical and creative competitive events received during 2 years preceding the scholarship appointment (only 1 place). - Russian Government scholarship - from the third year of study. Level: Bachelor's and Master's degrees. - Scholarship of the President of the Russian Federation - from the second year of study. Level: Bachelor's, Master's, Postgraduate. The President's Scholarship is 2,200 roubles per month Government Scholarship - 1 440 rubles. To participate, you need to fill in the application form and send it to e.markhaevainnopolis.ru with all scans of documents about your achievements. Application deadline: 25 October More information here and here

Selection of the best IU clubs We are starting a series of posts about the most active clubs, and heres the first five: ICE Club We focus on cybersecurity, teaching our members not only pentesting and the offensive side of information security but also investigation and prevention of attacks. Our team took 1st place in the All-Russian Student Cyber Battle (KDW2023) for defense and 2nd place in the 1st Championship of Russia in Sports Programming, earning the title of Candidate Master of Sports in Information Security Programming. ISD Team Choreographer Tanya Mikhailova is a teacher at the Kingstep dance studio and a member of Kingstep Crew. Under her guidance, our ISD Team participated in competitions such as MoveUp Dance Contest (1st place), Иди танцуй (2nd place), Pulse Dance Fest, and Студвесна, as well as performing at city events in Innopolis. We organize various events for students and residents, including Dance Day once a semester. Top choreographers from Kazan, such as Yulia Tikhomirova, Arina Matveeva, Katya Kostyleva, and others, have conducted master classes for our club. GDE GDE is the largest game development community in Tatarstan! We organize the most unusual events in the Russian gaming industry and have a unique approach to games. We have worked on projects for Tinkoff, Polki Chudes, Beco, and others, and we are currently actively gamifying Innopolis. Inntendo We create a cozy atmosphere for game lovers by playing cooperative games, watching game-related movies, and voicing visual novels. If someone wants to join our community, we make them write an article. We have held a dozen tournaments in various games, and at events, we pretend to be a dance club using Just Dance. UI Volleyball Team The University of Innopolis team has become a two-time winner of the Upper Uslon District Tournament, winning the cup from the Head of the Lower Uslon Rural Settlement! We hold the top spot in the club league and recently achieved victory over the ITMO University team in St. Petersburg. We also conduct master classes for educational institutions in Kazan. Lets wish these guys continued success in staying active!

Open Lecture for Employees and Students by Ilya Kuruzov: "Parameter-Free Algorithms in Decentralized Optimization" as part of the "Innopolis.Science" seminar Ilya Kuruzov's lecture will focus on the approach for the minimization of the sum of convex and smooth functions over a static network of agents without a centralized server. Additionally, limitations and open problems of this approach will be discussed Ilya Kuruzov is third-year PhD student at the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology, Department of Discrete Mathematics. He works in the Laboratory of Mathematical Methods of Optimization in MIPT, in IAI MSU, and in Innopolis University. Additionally, you have an opportunity to collaborate with Ilya on research projects, particularly in Parameter-Free Decentralized optimization. Tuesday, 26.11, 19:30 Location: 111 Language of presentation: Russian Join our community:
