A lecture for girls from a gynecologist! Dear girls! We invite you to a unique lecture dedicated to the most important aspects of women's health and well-being. At the lecture you will be able to learn: Anatomy and physiology of the female reproductive system: the basics that will help you better understand your body. Hormonal conditions: puberty, PMS, pregnancy, menopause how they affect your life. Contraception: types, differences, features and contraindications choose what is right for you. Sexual health and emotional background: how the relationship between these aspects affects your overall well-being. A lecture from a sexologist! Dear guys and girls! We invite you to an educational and therapeutic lecture-training dedicated to the intimate, personal, sexual sphere of our lives. At the meeting, you will learn about what else "sex" is for a person, besides its usual physiological function. We will discuss: Falling in love, jealousy, attraction and passion. Psychophysiological aspects of the intimate-sexual sphere of family relations, as well as methods of psychotherapy for the harmonization of paired relationships. Obstacles to harmony in relationships and ways to overcome them. Sexual fantasies: how to work with them and what they can tell you about us. Practices that will help you explore your sexuality and improve your interaction with your partner. Registration is required! December 8, 11:00 a.m. 313 room Event language: Russian

The application process for the 2024 Transport Grant has been extended! The Transport Grant allows students to receive subsidies to cover transportation costs. Grant amount: 8,000 rubles as a one-time payment, income tax: 13 for Russian citizens, 30 for foreign citizens. To participate in the contest, you need to register on the Student League website and complete the required actions within the appropriate timeframe. Conditions required for participation 1. A list of grades indicating academic performance for the last two semesters and no academic arrears (first year is not attached) 2. INN 3. Diplomas for participation in academic and extracurricular activities 4. You can also apply as a needy person and attach the appropriate evidence. This category is not available to international students! All documents and up-to-date information about the competition can be found here Join the group to ask any questions regarding the application process Deadline: till end of 9 December

Dear students and friends, I would like to invite you to my farewell party as I prepare to step down from my position as the Head of the Students affairs and alumni centre. Working at the university has been an incredible journey, especially because of the privilege of collaborating with the students. You have been my greatest source of inspiration, driving me to create new projects that were meant for your growth and success. Together, we have achieved so much from Innobootcamps to the creation and launch of new programs like the Tutorship Program, from exciting new events to talent scouting. We also tackled numerous challenges, and in my opinion, we always overcame them as a united team. Thank you for everything! I wish you all continued success and a deep love for this university. Lets come together one last time to say goodbye and relive the amazing moments weve shared. When? 9.12, Monday at 17:30 Where? Room 108

Дорогие студенты, Сегодня мы отмечаем особенный день день рождения нашего Университета Иннополис! Этот праздник объединяет всех - студентов, преподавателей и сотрудников, мы вместе, как одна большая семья, строим светлое будущее нашего Университета! Несмотря на то, что наш Университет еще очень молод, мы уже достигли больших успехов. Хотим поделиться этими результатами с вами: За последние 2 года увеличили количество студентов на 50 до 1 540 студентов без потери качества по результатам ЕГЭ. У нас растет количество международных и академических партнеров, на сегодняшний день их 52, а студенты успешно ездят по программам обмена. Вошли в список лучших университетов в мире Times Higher Education (601-800). Отпраздновали юбилейный выпуск наших выпускников! Запустили 3 новых профиля бакалавриата и 5 профилей магистратуры. Наши студенты занимали многочисленные призовые места в хакатанах, конкурсах, олимпиадах, гордимся ими! В честь праздника, еще раз напоминаем, используйте предоставленные возможности в Университете на полную мощность знания, ресурсы и время, которые вы проведете здесь, являются ценнейшими инвестициями в ваше будущее. Пусть каждый день в университете будет наполнен открытиями, новыми достижениями и яркими моментами. Мы верим в вас и гордимся, что вы выбрали Университет Иннополис. С уважением, Искандер Бариев, Директор Университета English version

Open Lecture for Employees and Students by Alexey Savvateev: "Permutations: General Theory and Applications" as part of the "Innopolis. Science" seminar This lecture will cover fundamental concepts in abstract algebra: permutation groups, cycle decomposition, and the parity of permutations. The speaker will discuss the rule for calculating the determinant of a fourth-order matrix and the homomorphism of algebraic systems. Students will reinforce their understanding through problem-solving and a game of "Fifteen" (Fifteen Puzzle). Alexey Savvateev, Doctor of Physical and Mathematical Sciences, popularizer of mathematics, Leading Researcher at the Central Economics and Mathematics Institute (CEMI) of the Russian Academy of Sciences, and Corresponding Member of the RAS in the Economics Section. December 18th, 9:0010:00 Language: Russian Location: Room 108 Join Online

Republican project "Atmosphere - 2025" Atmosphere is a youth educational program on the basics of electoral law. The project is aimed at developing knowledge and specific experience in the field of electoral law and the development of the electoral system among students aged 18 to 25. The educational program includes: - seminars aimed at improving the legal culture and the level of knowledge in the field of electoral law among young people; - professional trainings aimed at developing leadership skills and public speaking skills; - and many other things The winners and prize-winners of the Project will join the Youth Council of the Central Election Commission of the Republic of Tatarstan, become public assistants to the Central Election Commission of the Republic of Tatarstan, deputies of the State Council of the Republic of Tatarstan and deputies of representative bodies of local self-government in the districts, observers and volunteers at the elections. More information Registration at the link

Snowboarding Equipment Supply Point begins to provide its services to the University students! Equipment booking is free-of-charge and starting from today it is available on the corporate portal in the Sports Complex - Ski equipment reservation. The following rules must be followed while booking: - A user may submit up to two applications for the upcoming seven calendar days from the current date; - During the day there are two time slots available for booking daytime and evening time; - The interval between applications should be at least 24-hour period, that is, one user is prohibited to do the booking two days in a row; - Upon availability of free (unreserved) equipment at the day of booking, the user can use the service without limits described above; - Opening hours of the Ski Snowboarding Equipment Supply Point: From Friday to Sunday 9:00 a.m.- 9:00 p.m. Please note that the rental point will be closed on December 31, 2024 and January 1, 2025. Complete Regulations for renting and usage of the sports equipment can be found in the Ski booking section on the portal. Please note that ski passes should be purchased individually by each visitor at the arrival to Ski sports and recreation center Sviyaga Hiils. Ski Snowboarding Equipment Supply Point contacts: Dormitory 7, 1st floor, room No. 127 (next to the security point). Telegram: sportrentui

Russian Venture Forum 2025 The Russian Venture Forum has been the country's largest venture industry event since 2005. It is a meeting place for technology entrepreneurs, private and individual investors, corporations and development institutions. As part of the Forum, a job fair will be held on April 10-11, during which Forum partners and startups will hold various events to search for and consider candidates to work in their companies. Bachelor's and master's degree final year course students are invited to the forum. Dates of the event: April 9-11 More information

Push to you: Non-developers, get ready! Yandex is launching the first School of CRM Marketers. They will teach you what is not covered in universities: Build effective communications with users Grow customer loyalty Create a holistic process of their interaction with the product Increase business profitability Lectures from Yandex experts, practical tasks and the prospect of employment in the company. Lectures are conducted in Russian. Register and solve the test task before January 19

Scientific volunteering Scientific volunteering is one of the initiatives of the Decade of Science and Technology. As part of the initiative, everyone can participate in the collection, processing and analysis of data about the world, people, history and culture. The results of the volunteers' work will become part of scientific papers that will help researchers deal with issues that could not be solved alone. Why does science need volunteers? - Process and collect a large amount of data - To expand the geography of research - Reduce the burden on team - Find new team members For completing projects, you can get volunteer hours on Добро.рф, which will be useful for employment, selection for events and admission to the university. You can get acquainted with the current projects by following the link

Initiative "Science Nearby" As part of the implementation of the plan of events for holding the Decade of Science and Technology in the Russian Federation, the initiative "Science Nearby" is being implemented, one of the key events of which is an annual campaign that provides for visits to scientific, innovative, high-tech and other organizations in the format of excursions and lectures. IV International Cybersecurity Forum CyberV The Forum will host the International Interuniversity Cybersecurity Competition CyberSibir2025. CyberSibir2025 is a competition in the field of information and computer security, in which participants solve problems related to finding vulnerabilities in systems, encrypting and decrypting messages, analyzing digital traces and other cybersecurity tasks. The teams consist of 5-7 people. The program of the forum also provides for a comprehensive practice-oriented student track, unique in its scale and significance, aimed at improving the quality of cybersecurity development in the country. Date of the forum: March 26-28, 2025 Track date: March 27, 2025 Date of the competition: March 28, 2025 Deadline for registration for the competitiontrack: February 7, 2025 More information: about the forum, about the competition

All-Russian campaign Росстудент as part of the large-scale celebration of Russian Student Day! The essence of the campaign is simple: students and graduates of universities confess their love to their alma mater in a photo or video and publish their confessions on social networks. Step 1. Each participant in the campaign must write the name of the educational institution and draw a heart on a piece of paper (in a notebook, notepad, etc.). Content options - at the discretion of the participant from the following: 1. video of the process, how the student writes the name of the educational institution and draws a heart; 2. photo of the sheet with the name of the educational institution and a heart; 3. photo of the participant with the sheet, where the name of the educational institution and a heart are visible; 4. video declaration of love to the educational institution and gratitude to it; 5. other creative options using a sheet with the name of the educational institution and a drawn heart. Examples are attached to the information post about the campaign: and Step 2. The participant publishes a photo or video in a VK or Telegram post, be sure to include the hashtag Росстудент and rosstudent This way, the confession will spread throughout the country! The campaign will end on the birthday of the All-Russian Student Union - January 31.

Regional qualifying stage of the AllRussian Esports Student League - Tatarstan Esports Student League The competitions will be held in four types of programs: Dota 2, Counter-Strike 2, Starcraft 2 and Tekken. The league season will be held in three stages: the regional stage (March), the zonal stage (April), and the final stage (May). The winner of the regional stage will participate in the zonal stage of the competition, which aims to draw a quota for the final stage for each of the eight federal districts. Students between the ages of 16 and 25 can participate. We collect no more than 2 teams from the IU. Participation in the competition is free of charge. Detailed information, registration procedure and regulations are here

Educational robotics. Opening enrollment for a new course at the Center for the Development of Industrial Robotics at Innopolis University The course is held specifically for teachers of universities, colleges and schools together with Promobot, a Russian manufacturer of robotic solutions. The course program covers current topics in the industry that will help teachers adapt the educational process to modern technologies and introduce robotic systems into educational activities. You will also learn how to: work with simulators and robots, in particular with the educational Promobot M Edu; develop and implement training courses on robotics; organize project activities of pupils and students; prepare pupils and students for participation in robotic competitions, exhibitions, forums, and Olympiads. The training starts on March 24 and will last 6 weeks. After successfully defending your project, you will receive a certificate of advanced training. Find out more about the course and apply here

How to make friends and acquaintances in another country? Traveling to another country is always an exciting, but sometimes also a frightening adventure. New horizons, culture, and language can make you feel lonely, especially if you're just starting out in a new place. But don't despair! In our new post, we will share useful tips on how to make friends and acquaintances abroad. Join chat rooms and communities for those who have moved This will help not only to make new acquaintances, but also to learn useful information about the paperwork process, local and cultural peculiarities Visit public places and use small-talk An easy, non-committal conversation will help you make new acquaintances. Topics that you can talk about with strangers: weathernature, hobbies, pets, sports, professions, and travel. Use these topics as entry points to communication Arrange meetings for new acquaintances It can be a party at home or a brunch where you can invite new acquaintances Sign up for courses If you don't know the local language well, you should sign up for a foreign language course. This way you can not only improve your knowledge, but also meet new people Engage in volunteering This is another way to make friends and integrate into a new environment. Nothing brings you closer than working together Find a hobby For example, singing, painting, dancing, riding a motorcycle. This is how you can find like-minded people and meet nice people We hope this information will be useful to you!

Launch of the application campaign for the selection of startups in the "Technopark in the field of high technologies" This year, the Selection of startups will be held in a new format for the State Autonomous Institution "IT Park". The new format will involve a general selection for all sites of the State Autonomous Institution "IT Park": Site 52, Business Incubator and Startup Hub. Requirements for Site 52: 1. Tracking throughout the entire residency period. 3. Hot desk workstations in the State Autonomous Institution "IT Park" on Peterburgskaya st., 52, a meeting room and a recreation area. 4. 4000 rublesmonth for a team of up to 3 people. Requirements for the Business Incubator: 1. Availability of an MVP 2 The project has a legal entity or individual entrepreneur, OKVED: 62,63,72 (if absent, must be opened after passing the selection). 3. Legal entity or individual entrepreneur no older than 4 years. Conditions: 1. Residency for 1 year. 2. Legal address on ul. Peterburgskaya, 52, State Autonomous Institution "IT Park". 3. Personal equipped workstations in the State Autonomous Institution "IT Park" (ul. Peterburgskaya, 52, Kazan) meeting rooms and a recreation area. 4. 3000 rublesmonth for a team of up to 3 people. Requirements for the Startup Hub: 1. TRL from 4-5, confirmed business model, formed team, growing sales. 2. A project in the field of digital technologies in the b2b direction. 3. The project has a legal entity or individual entrepreneur, OKVED: 62,63,72. Conditions: 1. Residency for 9 months. 2. Personal equipped workplaces in the State Autonomous Institution "IT Park" named after Bashir Rameev, meeting rooms and a recreation area. 3. 9,500 rubles month for 1 workplace, a team of up to 6 people. Detailed information on the Selection is available in the Telegram channel. The selection of startups will take place on April 19-20, 2025. Applications are accepted until April 15 at the link.

Invitation to the SVD ES Seminar: "Real-Time Technologies for Customizable Systems" We will discuss the only domestic real-time operating system (RTOS) "Neutrino," which is used in critical areas: from industrial automation to avionics and telecommunications. What awaits you at the seminar? What is a real-time operating system and how does it differ from a general-purpose OS? Where is "Neutrino" used and what problems does it solve? What makes "Neutrino" reliable and fault-tolerant? What is real time? How to measure real time? This is a unique opportunity to gain practical knowledge and ask questions to experts! 1. "SVD Embedded Systems - Software Developer for Real-Time Embedded Systems," Igor Deryabin, Marketing Director. 2. "Overview of SVD ES Software Products - Purpose and Main Features," Andrey Senkov, Technical Director. 3. "RTOS "Neutrino" - Hardware Platform Support and Real-Time Characteristics," Vladimir Makhilev, Head of Industrial Projects Department. 4. "Application Development for RTOS "Neutrino," Vladimir Makhilev, Head of Industrial Projects Department. April 03, 11:00 12:30 Language of presentation: Russian Location: Room 313 Russian version

Today's Open Lecture for Employees and Students by Alexey Frolov: "On Error-Correcting Codes" as part of the "Innopolis.Science" Seminar This lecture focuses on error-correcting coding the science of how to correct errors that occur during information transmission. The main parameters of error-correcting codes and the trade-offs between them will be described. The existence of good codes was proven by C. Shannon, but he did not specify how to construct them. During the lecture, we will examine error-correcting codes from the 5G standard, as well as promising approaches for the transition to 6G. Alexey Frolov holds a Doctor of Physical and Mathematical Sciences degree, is a Skoltech professor, and Director of the Center for Wireless Communications and Internet of Things. He is a leading expert in information theory and telecommunications, has contributed to 5G standardization, led numerous industry projects, and received several awards for his research. Today: 17:30 18:30 Location: room 106 Language: Russian Russian version

All-Russian educational campaign online dictation "КосмоВсеобуч.рф 2025" The campaign will be held on the КосмоВсеобуч.рф platform in the format of an online dictation consisting of 20 questions covering various areas of knowledge: biographies of legends of Russian cosmonautics, life and work in orbit, planetary exploration and much more. Each participant will receive a memorable personalized certificate of participation, and the winners will receive gifts from the organizers and sponsors of the campaign: memorable books about space, tickets to the planetarium, branded sweatshirts, space food and a navigators watch from the Gagarin series, dedicated to the first manned flight into space. 29th adventure sports and intellectual game on urban orientation and local history "Tat-Rus" The team's task is to take the largest number of checkpoints. To take a checkpoint, you must reach the place described in the legend (description) of the checkpoint, record the required information and the time of taking the checkpoint in the route sheet, which is given to the team at the start. Taking the checkpoint must be carried out by the entire team. After completing the route, the answers are written in a Google form, the time of sending the answers is considered the finish time of the team. Each participant receives a badge and a certificate of participation! The start of the game will take place on the territory of Victory Park near the Eternal Flame in Kazan Applications for the game are accepted until April 24 in the group (pinned post on the wall) or by mail shepardkazanya.ru

Pushkin Card The Pushkin Card allows you to attend cultural events free of charge at government expense (5,000 per year) Who can get one? Russian citizens aged 14 to 22 How to get? Register on Gosuslugi Activate the card in the application "Gosuslugi. Culture" Where you can go? Cinema, Theaters, Museums, Online events Check your balance in the app or on Culture.RF Have time to spend - the money burns off at the end of the year!

Introducing "POLE" - Cultural Tourism Platform POLE is a vibrant digital platform designed to make cultural tourism in Tatarstan exciting, simple and personal. It targets young people and local explorers and helps you plan unique trips to museums, historical sites, cozy cafes and hidden gems for walking and relaxing. With interactive maps, filters, gamification, smart matching systems and connections with local guides - POLE turns every excursion into a story worth sharing. The platform will be available as a website for both mobile and desktop versions. Why it matters POLE isnt just about places its about experiences. The project brings cultural tourism closer to everyone and gives people the tools to explore their region in a modern, meaningful way. Be part of the project follow us, share your thoughts, and help shape the future of travel in Tatarstan! Launch Timeline June-July 2025 Follow Our Progress Stay updated on VK

Call for papers for the scientific journal of the AI Journey conference As part of the international conference on artificial intelligence AI Journey - "Journey into the world of artificial intelligence", the call for papers on AI for publication in a special issue of the journal "Proceedings of the Russian Academy of Sciences. Mathematics, informatics, control processes" and its English version has started again. Submit your application before August 20 and get the opportunity not only to publish an article, but also to present your research at the AI Journey 2025 conference and compete for a cash prize! The work can be written in Russian or English, and must not contain previously published materials. You can submit an application and read more about the rules for selecting articles at the link. The prize for the best article is 1 million rubles!

Additive Technologies and Reverse Engineering Cup from Роснефть A new competition of the large-scale IT Marathon, which the company has been holding for the seventh year in a row. The prize fund of the Cup is 500,000 rubles before taxes. Participants will have to perform a full cycle of reverse engineering of equipment parts using 3D scanning and additive technologies. The competition will be held in two stages. Based on the results of the first tests, 10 students will be selected who will meet on September 14-15 at the TNF forum in Tyumen, where the Cup final will be held. Participation is individual. To complete the tasks, you will need skills in 3D scanning, 3D modeling, reverse engineering, development of design documentation, engineering analysis and strength calculations, 3D printing of parts. Registration is open on the website until June 30, 2025.

The talk within the research seminar of the AI Centre Alexey Petrenko (Ph.D., Budker Institute of Nuclear Physics SB RAS) will talk about Application of large language models to problem solving in elementary particle accelerator physics Abstract Large language models (ChatGPT, DeepSeek, Qwen) have turned out to be an unexpectedly effective tool for solving some typical problems in accelerator physics and engineering, such as: 1) fast writing of numerical schemes for calculating electromagnetic fields and tracking particles in these fields; 2) translating analytical descriptions of physical processes from theoretical publications into working programs; 3) use of open source libraries; 4) translating the description of accelerator structures from one format to another. Perhaps the greatest advantage of using large language models for such tasks is that the first working version of the program that solves the task, even if not completely, can be obtained very quickly. At the same time, the tendency of language models to hallucinate, especially when working with rare libraries and data formats, is a significant inconvenience. 7 May: 10:30-12:00 Russian Room 321 For staff and students

Open lectures for Employees and Students by Fedor Stonyakin On a Modern Analog of the Smoothness Condition in Optimization and Vladimir Gordin Mathematics for Weather Forecasting and Climate Assessment as part of the "Innopolis.Science" Seminar Fedor Sergeevich Stonyakin is a Doctor of Physical and Mathematical Sciences, Professor at Innopolis University, leading researcher at the Laboratory of Advanced Combinatorics and Network Applications, and Professor at the Department of Discrete Mathematics, Faculty of Physics, Mathematics and Computer Science, Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology (MIPT). Fedor Stonyakin will talk about a recently proposed class of smooth optimization problems, in which the smoothness property of the objective functions is described using two parameters instead of a single Lipschitz constant of the gradient. This approach is motivated by objective functions arising in neural network training tasks and reflects the correlation between the growth of the Hessian matrix norms and the local smoothness constant. During the lecture, the speaker will discuss how this new smoothness class has advanced the theory of first-order optimization methods and what future research directions are possible in this area. June 4th, 10:4012:10 Location: Room 107 Language: Russian Join Online Vladimir Alexandrovich Gordin is a Doctor of Physical and Mathematical Sciences, Research Professor at the National Research University Higher School of Economics, Professor at Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology, and leading researcher at the Russian Hydrometeorological Center. Vladimir Alexandrovich Gordin will explain which natural processes can be measured precisely and which remain beyond the reach of modern science. During the lecture, the expert will reveal the principles of Earth's structure and methods for analyzing long-term changes in atmospheric and oceanic systems. Participants will learn about mathematical models used to describe atmospheric dynamics and how meteorologists prepare initial data for the complex differential equations underlying weather forecasting. June 4th, 16:0017:00 Location: Room 107 Language: Russian Join Online
